.  Calarca is a municipality in the eastern part of the department of Quindío, Colombia. It is located 4 km east of the departmental capital Armenia. Its nickname is La Villa del Cacique.

Just like in others towns in the Quindio, the economy is based in colombian coffee crops, plantain and manioc. The ecotourism is promoted with destinations such as
peñasblancas park, with rock climbing and hiking activities
Mariposario enthomologic display specialized in Lepidoptera
Quindio botanical garden
Other important source of income is money remittance from people working in other countries to their families.

peñasblancas park, with rock climbing and hiking activities
Mariposario enthomologic display specialized in Lepidoptera
Quindio botanical garden

very diverse options of foods. You will find anything from hot dogs to the most amazing traditional dishes and desserts. Excellent restaurants in the outskirts of town. Here you will find a list of some of the local restaurants. www.calarca.net.

Hotel Karlaka (www.hotelkarlaka.com)
A great and warm place for holidays: kind staff, all types of rooms (nicely decorated), amazing swimming pools and a turkish bath to relax.. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for people who like to be surrounded by a natural environment (there is even a walking trail through the forest and a small lake inside the hotel!). 
Plus: the hotel is eco-friendly, a good means to match my convictions and my way of travelling.
